result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica L Bauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Huber Law/Work Release Notification
Criminal Case Settlement
submitted by Attorney Fischer at plea/sentencing hearing
with attached victim restitution request form(s)

Case called at 10:25am [mo]
Defendant Jessica L Bauer in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance; submits a Victim Impact Statement to the Court. 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court reviews the Victim Impact Statement

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 
Statement made by Ms. Bauer

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

--to serve  90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work-release privileges, to commence on     10/23/15 at 6:00pm.
--The Court notes that work-release may be for employment, child care or counseling
--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment as approved by the Agent
--No contact with Leslie or Marc Schmidt or Pat Clark, unless pre-authorized by both victim and Agent for purposes of mediation, apology, may be in person or through letter or phone call
--No presence at Pickets
--to pay restitution in the amount of $22,110 to Society Insurance
--to pay restitution in the amount of $500 to Pickets LLC. for deductible
--to pay restitution in the amount of $137.87 to Pickets LLC. for other acquired costs 
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  1  day
recess: 11:32am

Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-14-2015 10:15 am

[MK] case called at 8:32am. 
Defendant Jessica L Bauer in court with Attorney Joseph F Fischer.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance.  
Attorney Fischer requests that the case be scheduled for change of plea and sentencing in approximately thirty days; this will allow time for Ms. Bauer to ensure that she has fulltime employment, and it will allow time for the attorney to finalize the details of their agreement. 
recess 8:35am.

Case called at 1:24pm[MO & MK]
Judge Koschnick presiding for Branch II
Defendant Jessica L. Bauer appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no presence at Pickets Store LLC in Sullivan, WI
--no contact with Marc or Leslie Schmidt

recess 1:30 pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on  2/18/2015 2:40pm  (2) Status Conference on 3/10/15 at 9:30am
